required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Exploratory Trial Using sEMG to Differentiate PNES From Epileptic Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Trial Using sEMG to Differentiate PNES From Epileptic Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study of subjects receiving standard of care therapy, while admitted to Epilepsy Monitoring Unit, Department of Neurology, General Hospital Hietzing with Neurological Center Rosenhügel. Additional monitoring provided by the SPEAC System will be compared to the gold standard, vEEG. The SPEAC System is being evaluated while being used in adjunct to standard of care.

primary_outcome.measure: 3 independent physicians' abilities to differentiate between epileptic events (with upper extremity motor involvement) and PNES (with upper extremity motor involvement) using vEEG, using a majority rules approach (2 out of 3)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is to test a physician's ability to differentiate between epileptic events (with upper extremity motor involvement) and PNES (with upper extremity motor involvement) using vEEG review. PNES and epileptic seizures will initially be identified, described, and documented following routine clinical care (vEEG).

primary_outcome.measure: 3 independent physicians' abilities to differentiate between epileptic events (with upper extremity motor involvement) and PNES (with upper extremity motor involvement) using sEMG, using a majority rules approach (2 out of 3)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is to test a physician's ability to differentiate between epileptic events (with upper extremity motor involvement) and PNES (with upper extremity motor involvement) using sEMG recorded by the SPEAC System. PNES and epileptic seizures will initially be identified, described, and documented following routine clinical care (vEEG). The sEMG record will be evaluated to identify PNES, displaying upper extremity motor components, and epileptic seizures, displaying upper extremity (UE) motor components. It is anticipated that > 70% of PNES with UE motor involvement identified by vEEG will be identified by sEMG recordings as well.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the System's ability to detect GTC seizures, as compared to vEEG monitoring
secondary_outcome.description: It is anticipated that >70% of GTC seizures identified by vEEG will be identified by the SPEAC System's automated alarms as well.

arm_group.description: Participants who experience a non-epileptic event with upper extremity motor involvement, while enrolled in the trial
Participants who experience an epileptic event with upper extremity motor involvement, while enrolled in the trial

intervention.intervention_name: Brain Sentinel Monitoring and Alerting System
intervention.description: The Brain Sentinel Monitoring and Alerting System is indicated for use as an adjunct to seizure monitoring in adults in the home or healthcare facilities during periods of rest. The device is to be used on the belly of the biceps muscle to analyze surface electromyographs (sEMG) signals that may be associated with generalized tonic-clonic (GTC) seizures and to provide an alarm to alert caregivers of unilateral, appendicular, tonic extension that could be associated with a GTC seizure. The System records and stores sEMG data for subsequent review by a trained healthcare professional.

study_pop.textblock: People with a suspected history of Psychogenic Non Epileptic Seizures with upper extremity motor involvement. and/or Epileptic Seizures with upper extremity motor involvement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has a suspected history of PNES with upper extremity motor involvement or epileptic seizures with upper extremity motor involvement.
2. Is being admitted to a hospital for routine vEEG monitoring related to seizures.
3. Male or female between the ages of 18-99.
4. If female and of childbearing potential, has a negative pregnancy test.
5. Can understand and sign written informed consent prior to the performance of any study assessments.
6. Subject must be competent to follow all study procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
1.Intracranial EEG electrodes are being used.

overall_official.affiliation: Krankenhaus Hietzing mit Neurologischem Zentrum Rosenhügel

facility.name: Krankenhaus Hietzing mit Neurologischem Zentrum Rosenhugel
